name: Ulu Paung
description:
In Batak Toba, one of the tribes in North Sumatra, Indonesia, "Ulu Paung" is a name of a carved ornament on wood, which is called "Gorga" in Bataknese. It is in the form of a giant creature, half human and half animal, often found in the form of a buffalo horned head. It is placed at the top of the Batak Toba traditional house and was interpreted as a symbol of shelter or protection and strength.

The statues behind Ulu Paung called "Pangulubalang”, a stone statue used by the Bataknese as a village's guardian. In ancient times, Pangulubalang was filled with spirit and mystical powers, which would alert the villagers if there were enemies threats, disasters, disease outbreaks, etc.

I made these editions with a hope that my fellow artists and collectors would find protection and strength in these times of pandemic.

Digital illustration with Procreate and Ai, 2022
